descriptions.overview: The Gibraltar Mailboxes steel mounting board is made from heavy-duty galvanized steel for supreme quality and strength. Various mounting hole patterns make this mounting board compatible with nearly all USPS approved mailboxes. This mounting board is designed to hold up to 110 lbs. evenly distributed, and comes with all mounting hardware.
list: Constructed from heavy-duty galvanized steel to keep mailbox secured in place
Various pre-drilled holes allow for installation of most bottom or side mounted mailboxes
Engineered to hold up to 110 lbs evenly distributed
Match with any Gibraltar Mailboxes with the designation letter code A, B, C, or D

reviews.title: "Easy to use but hardware quality issues"
reviews.text: Very sturdy and flexible mailbox mounting kit. I used it to install a slightly oversized mailbox to a post with a crossarm (all purchased at Lowes). Very good instructions, and fit my application perfectly.However, the hardware bag had serious quality issues. There were only three of the four required #10-24 x 1 3/4" screws. I had to go back to the store to get replacements. Also, two of the four required #8 x 1 3/4" galvanized wood screws already had the heads stripped (definitely weren't new screws). I was fortunate enough to have a few spare wood screws available at home to replace these.Overall, this is a good product and I would suggest it to a friend. But I would suggest you ask a store representative allow you to inspect the hardware bag before leaving the store.
reviews.author: Hobart

reviews.title: "An excellent product. ."
reviews.text: This is an excellent product for use with mailboxes of various sizes. Everything that could make my mailbox installation was a challenge but thank goodness I purchased this mounting bracket on my way out the door. I have an oversized mailbox on a new post and this bracket can also work with several different mailbox posts and several different mailbox sizes. All hardware for the various "situations" were included in the purchase and it was at a very reasonable price. Installation was quick and simple.
reviews.author: DeeJay

reviews.title: "great product"
reviews.text: This base is great. I was concerned it may not fit the larger mailbox, but the kit includes all hardware to fit either standard or large size boxes. All stainless hardware, inc. stainless ny-lock nuts with 8 spacers. It fits on a standard 4x4 post just fine. It's also made of heavy gauge, powder coated steel. Solid.
reviews.author: Gageman6434

reviews.title: "Heavy Duty Bracket!"
reviews.text: I purchased this bracket for use with the Mayne Westbrook mailbox post. It worked great. It has a lot of pre-set holes that fit a wide variety of mailboxes/posts. I like the fact that it comes with a LOT of hardware. It also comes with poly risers (which I needed for the mailbox post I purchased). This is an inexpensive bracket, but it is made with quality. I'm sure there will be no issues.
reviews.author: Freggy79

reviews.title: "Sturdy mail box bracket"
reviews.text: Nice sturdy mail box bracket. can fit any size mail box and is not going to crack and break like the plastic ones do. Can be mounted several ways and works on just about all posts. Don't cheap out and get that $4 plastic one...go for a couple bucks more and be happy for a long time.
reviews.author: lisasbunnies

reviews.title: "Serves its purpose well"
reviews.text: I purchased this to mount a lockable metal mailbox. The mounting bracket is well made for mounting a mailbox to a 4x4 post. However, it could use some improvements for mounting to an arm.First, the mounting hardware. Since the turned-down parts for attaching to a 4x4 post interfere with placing it directly on the arm of a post with arm, it includes plastic spacers. I did not like this as it seemed as if this would not be as strong as if the bracket were able to sit directly on top of the arm. I ended up modifying the bracket to flatten out two of the tabs so that the bracket could sit directly in contact with the arm. I was able to then use the holes in the tabs plus some of the other holes in the bracket to attach the bracket to the arm. I also did not like the small nuts and bolts provided for attaching the mailbox. I had some heavier ones which I wanted to use. I drilled out four of the holes in the bracket to allow for the larger bolts. I also decided to use two lag screws to go through two of the holes in the box, through the bracket, and into the arm to reinforce it even more. Since the holes in the box did not line up with the holes in the bracket, I marked and drilled two new holes in the bracket.After finishing the job, the mailbox is very secure. It would be very difficult for someone to try to remove the box from the arm, especially since there is no space between the bracket and the arm into which someone could place a pry-bar.The only thing I would change on the bracket would be to lengthen the tabs on the sides of the 4x4 cut-out which face the center from the long sides. If they were longer, then screws could be put in from the sides without them being angled up enough so they come through the post in the middle. It would be better to have them go in level. It would also be good to be able to drill all the way through the post and use a long bolt and lock nut to attach the bracket to the post. A longer tab would make this possible.
reviews.author: StephenH

reviews.title: "Easily Installed Mounting"
reviews.text: Easily mounted to an existing 4x4 upright and standard size mailbox. Very stable and easy to install. Included hardware worked great. Installation took about twenty minutes. Time will tell on durability but at the moment it seems fantastic, especially for the price paid and time spent installing.
reviews.author: papasmurf

reviews.title: "better then plastic."
reviews.text: Our original base was plastic and broke during a small wind causing the mail box to be blown on the ground. So a very good investment due to it being metal and easy to install.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "Just what I neeeded!"
reviews.text: My mailbox bracket, plastic, broke from the post during the recent snow storm. I just wanted a replacement bracket and not replace the mailbox, post etc. This universal bracket was easy to install. Its steel so I'm sure it going to be there a lot longer than the plastic one.
reviews.author: KimS

reviews.text: It is working well.  I might make one suggestion:  I have mine on a 4" x 4" treated post.  The top of the post is flush with the top surface of the mounting board. I secured the mounting board with two screws in each side.  It would have been nice if the screw holes were offset from the holes on the adjoining side.  In other words, the sides opposite one another might be, say, one inch down from the top, and the other two sides opposite one another could be, say, 1.5 inches down from the top.  This avoids having the screws run into the adjoining screws "around the corner" from them.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Best mailbox mount I've seen."
reviews.text: This mounting bracket is sturdy, heavy duty steel with a thick coating of paint and comes with all the hardware needed. It has multiple pre-drilled hole patterns to make mounting a standard or oversized mailbox to a variety of posts. This bracket does not flex like the old one I replaced so the mailbox does not wobble at all on the post. I was impressed that most of the screws, nuts and washers were stainless steel - so not rust worries. The nuts for the screws that attach the bracket to the box have nylon inserts so these will not work themselves loose like my old ones did. All the hardware came sealed in a plastic bag and nothing was missing. There was a very clear instruction sheet with diagrams showing the various types of posts and how to place the bracket on each. Installation was quick and easy. Everything fit the way it was supposed to. Very pleased with this product!
reviews.author: Diego

reviews.title: "Just as advertised."
reviews.text: Super support for a mailbox w/ a heavy 50# mailbox cover. superior strength
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Does Not work with Oversized Mail Box"
reviews.text: We had a cross arm  4x4 pre cut cedar mail box post, purchased at Lowes as well as G Oversized Mailbox marked (L) with the magnetic door and this mount.  the problem is this mail box mount is much too small to work properly with a (L) size box.  They do include little round extenders, but this was just a fiasco that was not going to work.  The company indicates on the package of the mount that it will fit the Large size box, but it did not for us.  This product is sturdy and probably good for a small to medium sized box.  We went and cut an old wooden board, to the size and thickness we needed and worked great. Even the mailbox boards for sale that were precut were not wide enough for the (L) box, look carefully before you purchase, save yourself some time in the long run.
reviews.author: Frank

reviews.title: "Easy mailbox mount."
reviews.text: Very solid mount. More than enough to permanently mount a mailbox on a veryical 4x4 post. My only issue was that my post was about a 1/4 smaller than the fixed opening in the mounting plate. I solved this with washers as spacers between the post and plate. I also thought the metal bent over in the middle for a flange was a little short. You have to angle the screws up a bit on the 4 side holes to get a screwdrive in there. I added 4 extra screws for additional strength so I actually used all 8 holes. All in all, it was nicer than just a flat board.
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "Works great"
reviews.text: Works just as hoped. Many options for all types of posts.
reviews.author: JayRich

reviews.title: "Mailbox mounting bracket"
reviews.text: This was the only mounting bracket available, so that is what I HAD to buy.  Little did I know that it was not meant for an "oversized" mailbox, which we had purchased at Lowe's, until we were actually trying to attach the mailbox to the bracket.  What would have been super great would have been a "mail box installation kit" or, at the very least, an instruction sheet of all items needed, to let us know every item we would need to put in a new mailbox post and mailbox.  Precut 4x4's in the mailbox section would also be wonderful, as the store saw was down when we went to cut one cut.  We ended up making 3 trips to Lowe's to get everything that was needed to install our new mailbox.  I'd say our mailbox is about 80-85% functional, as it wobbles a bit when the door is opened on the non-oversized bracket.  Hoping it lasts a while anyway.
reviews.author: Susie

reviews.title: "Was not universal"
reviews.text: The only reason I gave this a poor rating is because from the description I was led to believe this bracket would work on any mailbox post. Unfortunately that was not the case. There was no way to make the bracket work with the post we had.
reviews.author: upsetinbama

reviews.title: "Mailbox mounting bracket"
reviews.text: This product made replacing a mail box supper easy
reviews.author: Agirl4country

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Cindy

reviews.title: "It is not universal! Did not work with my mailbox"
reviews.text: I was able to purchase just the hardware for way less after purchasing the universal item only to find out it wouldn't work with the mailbox I orchard at Lowe's.
reviews.author: Snowman

reviews.title: "Mailbox mount"
reviews.text: Fit the box fine.  One screw had a threading problem or this would have been 5 stars!
reviews.author: Skyking713

reviews.title: "Functional and Useful"
reviews.text: The mounting board was quite useful once I figured out how to make it work with the large mailbox I was installing. The instructions were detailed for regular size mailboxes but lacking detail for large boxes. Difficult to align on pvc mailposts.
reviews.author: Cam

reviews.title: "Mailbox mount"
reviews.text: This is a great item for a quick mailbox mount. The only drawback is the mounting screws for the box. The screws broke off very easily. I would suggest pre drilling into your post before mounting the plate.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Poor Design/ Small Mounting Flange"
reviews.text: I returned the item straight away.  The Mount to the 4x4 post is not long enough for engagement.  Screws can strip easily.  Found a much better option on that "prime" site for less money.
reviews.author: michael

reviews.title: "Good but there seems to small issues"
reviews.text: The side where you attach the box to the board has 2 round holes and 2 oblong holes. My box did not align with the holes. I had to drill out a new hole about 1/2" from the oblong hole.
reviews.author: chris

reviews.text: MUCH NICER HAVING HOLES LOCATED TO BE ABLE TO SECURE IT ACCORDING TO THE MAILBOX BEING INSTALLED SURE BEATS USING WOOD UNDERNEATH WHERE IT WOULD GET WEATHER BEATEN AND SPLITS IN TWO
reviews.author: RS

reviews.title: "Simple but not for every post type"
reviews.text: Pretty simple to install but the post we purchased does not comply with this item. So we got it on as best as we could. The mailbox shakes a lot so hopefully it won't come off.
reviews.author: FloridaLiving

reviews.title: "A Must-Have!"
reviews.text: Great product. Makes attaching a mailbox so much easier. Can be attached in several ways to different styles of mailbox posts. Very sturdy.
reviews.author: Mexico03

reviews.title: "Perfect fit!"
reviews.text: Gibraltar makes mailbox installation easy! This was the suggested piece for our size mailbox and it fits perfectly. Would highly recommend.
reviews.author: Sarah

reviews.title: "Mailbox adapter works in several ways"
reviews.text: This mailbox adapter worked very well for my application. It has many possible ways to use this because it has many screw holes.
reviews.author: Dave24153

reviews.title: "Mailbox mount"
reviews.text: Fit the box fine.  One screw had a threading problem or this would have been 5 stars!

reviews.title: "iti s what it is."
reviews.text: this worked for the mailbox i was installing.  it is a nice heavy duty item.
reviews.author: oldtownnut

reviews.title: "Good"
reviews.text: Very  sturdy but needs to have a few more holes where you mount the box.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Mounting Board"
reviews.text: This mounting board made it efficient to post my mailbox.  Easy to use.
reviews.author: Ken

reviews.title: "Easy to install"
reviews.text: Mounting board was easy to install and worked well for my new mailbox
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Works great"
reviews.text: Bought the plate to mount a new box. Easy install, holds well
reviews.author: Heather

reviews.text: spacers are difficult to line up I just mounted upside down

questions.question: "Does this product fit a 2" round pipe mailbox post?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: cc
answers.text: It can be mounted on top of a 4x4 wood post or on the horizontal cross arm of a mailbox post.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The bracket can be mounted in several ways. It fits just about any post including a 2" round pipe.

answers.author: papasmurf
answers.text: No. It was designed to fit a 4"x4" (3 1/2" x 3 1/2") wood post.

questions.question: "Our mail box is on one of the rural multi box stands with 2" round uprights. Each upright has a removable bracket with a flat plate but the holes don'"
questions.author: SteveT

answers.author: SteveT
answers.text: will definitely call. Out of town on business this week, but as this is a mail box I bought at Lowes I really want to sort out the mounting ... out here in the rural back of beyond where a big mail box avoids a few trips into town a month we need a way of attaching them to the stand that doesn't break the bank!

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. We need to have more information please contact customer service 1-800-647-7063.

questions.question: "Can we put two mailboxes on the same post with this??"
questions.author: Joe

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our product. This mounting bracket is designed to be installed on one mailbox only.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, two mailboxes cannot be mounted on the bracket.

questions.question: "what is the width & length of the mounting bracket"
questions.author: chris

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The dimensions of the bracket are 75" H x 6" W x 11.75" D.

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. The dimensions of the UMB bracket is .75" height, 6" wide, 11.75 depth

questions.question: "what is the width? I need an 8 inch wide base."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Diego
answers.text: The bracket itself is 6 inches wide to fit a standard US mailbox, but the kit comes with spacers to let it be used with an 8 inch wide box also.

answers.author: Cindy
answers.text: Dimensions are as follows L24"xW19 3/4"x 13" hope this helps

questions.question: "What's the depth? You give height (which is useless) and width, but there's a dimension missing."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Gageman6434
answers.text: I was apprehensive about the lack of dimensional data, but from what I saw, this will fit all standard and "estate" boxes...

questions.question: "Can this adapter be used with a wooden post?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. Yes.

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. No, a 4x4 square post does not come with the UMBS0B06 mounting bracket.

questions.question: "Will this work with the Oasis 360 locking mailbox?"
questions.author: MLR

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: If you are mounting the Oasis 360 mailbox on a 4 x 4 post you will need Architectural Mailboxes adapter plate 7540B. This mount is only specified for use with Gibraltar mailboxes.

questions.question: "Is this compatible with the Mail Manager (Lowe's Item #423285, Model # 7506) mailbox?"
questions.author: Steve
